<td style="padding-top:20px;padding-left:15px;padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, we're looking back on a year of Morning Brew content that was mostly written atop converted BP tables or stacks of cookbooks. Since the rest of this newsletter is basically Morning Brew folks gassing up other Morning Brew folks, we'll start off by doing a sincere: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thank you so much for reading this year. We wish you and your loved ones a happy holiday and very precedented 2021.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LIFESTYLE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/24/journey-sidekick-morning-brews-lifestyle-vertical?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Turning Lemons Into a Newsletter
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Sidekick header" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTgyL3NpZGVraWNrX2hlYWRlci5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The unexpected star of our editorial lineup this year: a new lifestyle vertical. Here's how <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sidekick/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sidekick</a>, our recommendations newsletter, was born.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Early March: </strong>We threw together a "Morning Brew's Guide to Living Your Best Quarantined Life" that broke Google Docs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">March 16: </strong>The Google Docs guide graduated to a website story that remains, by far, our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/16/morning-brews-guide-living-best-quarantined-life?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most-viewed article</a> of 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">March 23: </strong>We started to include a "Daily Quarantine Planner" section at the bottom of this newsletter to give you all ideas of things to do when your calendars were wiped out by Covid.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">April 6: </strong>The first issue of The Essentials, a newsletter that built off the original guide and the planner, was sent to readers looking for quarantine recommendations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">November 23: </strong>After 80+ issues of The Essentials, the newsletter got a makeover to become <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sidekick/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sidekick</a>, with writer <a href="https://twitter.com/rachelcantor_?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rachel Cantor</a> at the helm.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some of the most popular recommendations from Sidekick's evolution:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Level up:</strong></span><span> Use </span><span><a href="https://ballertodo.com/?utm_campaign=Recomendo&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Baller ToDo</a></span><span>, the </span><span><a href="https://www.eisenhower.me/eisenhower-matrix/?utm_campaign=Recomendo&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eisenhower Matrix</a></span><span>, and the </span><span><a href="https://www.marinaratimer.com/SBFO8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pomodoro Technique</a></span><span> for productivity.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Listen:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://asoftmurmur.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A Soft Murmur</a></span><span> for ambient noise and </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/5s8443tfYUq3LLARJwGeYP?si=x-Q2HALkRk-ip9JSu1qDYA&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Big Desk Energy</a></span><span> for work beats.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Get lost in a hole:</strong></span><span> A really long list of </span><span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1j4rj883slFvh1zZLGedqQFM0wqCrHlIEPE62K0LkKak/edit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">icebreakers</a></span><span>; ASCII, emoji, and text meme </span><span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Mvq6HYMvX_0uB6z8Bph5LnmMkTtvgAqC2rpMDSSL2Eg/edit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">templates</a></span><span>; and </span><span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TrLhiplUxXgqe0Cc7T4MdibZVKF4yeLZ1ptHzkz6d48/edit#gid=256281926?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">movie recs</a></span><span> from the Brew crew.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUARANTINE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Home, but Not Alone
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Zoom call" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26gR2l3wbvlJjldFS/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Zoom call" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26gR2l3wbvlJjldFS/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the world shut down and pajamas became acceptable workplace attire, we looked to readers to share uplifting stories. Here are some of our favorite responses to those polls.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Any funny/bizarre stories about working from home?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Left NYC to go to my parents' house—I was presenting to 100+ people and my dad walked through at 9:30am yelling, 'Is it too early for a drink?'"—Anonymous</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I'm on a video call with my company and the next thing I notice is a bird on one of the participants' heads. The bird stayed in place the remainder of the call and even chimed in with a hello. The participant didn't even pause."—Chaz in Brookings, SD</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Tell us about your local heroes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"My elderly neighbor loves to sit on his front porch when the weather is nice. On Sunday afternoon, a younger man who I believe is his son pulled into his driveway. He pulled a lawn chair and a cooler out of his trunk and sat down in the yard in front of the porch to maintain distance while they talked and drank a few beers."—Jackson in Kansas City, MO</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I've been stranded in the U.S. because I'm a student on financial aid and all international flights to Nepal have been canceled. My American roommate and her family offered me housing and food for as long as I need to wait out this storm together."—Suraj in Las Vegas, NV </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">3. How about your dating life? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Did a virtual date for the first time. When the girl turned on her camera, I saw for a quick glance what was at least 50 crushed up Mountain Dew cans on the floor by her bed. I tried not to think anything of it until the conversation turned to what our favorite drinks were. To spice things up I said my favorite drink was Mountain Dew...she didn't bat an eye and proceeded to tell me she doesn't really drink soda. The call ended about five minutes later when I told her I can't date a liar."—Anonymous</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I literally haven't touched another human being in over eight months."—A very lonely anonymous</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ You can find more WFH horror stories <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/americas-funniest-home-video-calls?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. And for more heartwarming stories, here are <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/18/brew-readers-share-good-coronavirus-news?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two</a> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/20/brew-readers-share-positive-stories-local-communities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roundups</a> we put together. </p>
</td>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen the world shut down and pajamas became acceptable workplace attire, we looked to readers to share uplifting stories. Here are some of our favorite responses to those polls.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e1. Any funny/bizarre stories about working from home?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Left NYC to go to my parents' house—I was presenting to 100+ people and my dad walked through at 9:30am yelling, 'Is it too early for a drink?'\"—Anonymous\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I'm on a video call with my company and the next thing I notice is a bird on one of the participants' heads. The bird stayed in place the remainder of the call and even chimed in with a hello. The participant didn't even pause.\"—Chaz in Brookings, SD\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e2. Tell us about your local heroes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"My elderly neighbor loves to sit on his front porch when the weather is nice. On Sunday afternoon, a younger man who I believe is his son pulled into his driveway. He pulled a lawn chair and a cooler out of his trunk and sat down in the yard in front of the porch to maintain distance while they talked and drank a few beers.\"—Jackson in Kansas City, MO\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I've been stranded in the U.S. because I'm a student on financial aid and all international flights to Nepal have been canceled. My American roommate and her family offered me housing and food for as long as I need to wait out this storm together.\"—Suraj in Las Vegas, NV \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e3. How about your dating life? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Did a virtual date for the first time. When the girl turned on her camera, I saw for a quick glance what was at least 50 crushed up Mountain Dew cans on the floor by her bed. I tried not to think anything of it until the conversation turned to what our favorite drinks were. To spice things up I said my favorite drink was Mountain Dew...she didn't bat an eye and proceeded to tell me she doesn't really drink soda. The call ended about five minutes later when I told her I can't date a liar.\"—Anonymous\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I literally haven't touched another human being in over eight months.\"—A very lonely anonymous\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ You can find more WFH horror stories \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/americas-funniest-home-video-calls?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.
